availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Blandville, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Son of George Sullivan and Thersey Sullivan. Married to Malinda Sullivan. Father of Sarah G. Sullivan, George H. Sullivan, Susan Sullivan, John Sullivan, and Mary O. Sullivan. Farmer in Milburn, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Blandville in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Milburn, p. 276. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 23. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 5. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District 2, p. 37.
